prompt: When was lithography invented?
text: Lithography was invented in 1798 by Alois Senefelder, a German artist and printmaker. He discovered that when he used a greasy substance on a stone or metal plate and then applied ink to it, the ink would adhere to the greasy areas but not to the non-greasy parts. This allowed him to create images and designs on the plate, which could then be transferred onto paper or other surfaces using a press. This invention revolutionized the printing industry and made it possible to produce high-quality, mass-produced prints.
